item.title: Report X-2024031436
item.description:
Report X-2024031436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 22 during the AM sort a package was found leaking. the package was marked as UN1789, HYDROCHLORIC ACID, 8, III. two plastic bottles were inside and one of them was leaking due to the cap being loose. The package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024030583
item.description:
Report E-2024030583

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 19, 2024, one (!) 50-pound box of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer and loading dock floor. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024031298
item.description:
Report X-2024031298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Delivery driver brought package back to station and it was leaking material. Driver bagged the package. QA notified manager and manager placed bagged package in a hazmat bag and in a hazmat tote. Tote was brought to the HazMat cage and placed in the HWPA. DescribePack: Pail was cracked on the side near the bottom. Crack approximately 4 inches. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag then in a hazmat tote and brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024031100
item.description:
Report X-2024031100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in trailer during the unloading process. Package was discovered already damaged and leaking. Package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the damaged hazmat cage, where it was repackaged into a damaged hazmat salvage drum. DescribePack: External packaging (cardboard box) was stained and wet. Inspection shows a plastic bag suspended by carboard liners on all sides. Plastic bag had leaked from tied point. Bag contained a metal can which had been taped shut but had leaked from the lid. Contents of metal can is an absorbent and a glass 1QT bottle of Nitric Acid 70% which had broken, leaking all contents into absorbent and external packaging. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed from service flow and placed inside damaged hazmat cage. Internal packaging and absorbent prevented external release other than the box being visibly discolored and moist.
